question: In a population having mid-year population of 1000, there are 150 children less than 15 years and 50 elderly more than 65 years of age. Calculate dependency ratio ?
exp: Dependency ratio = (Propoion of ppl in < 15yrs of age + >65yrs of age) / Propoion of ppl in 15-64 yrs of age = 150+50/800 = 0.25

question: In child woman ratio, number of 0-4 years aged children are expressed:
exp: Child woman ratio: Is number of 0-4 years aged children expressed per 1000 women in reproductive age group. (15 - 49 years) OTHER IMPOANT PARAMETERS: GFR :- x1000. DR :- / .
opb: Per 1000 women in reproductive age group (15-49 years)
opc: Per 1000 married women in reproductive age group
opd: Per 1000 married women in post - reproductive age group

question: 50 people are suffering from cholera in a population of 5000. Out of 50 suffering from cholera, 10 died. But the total deaths are 50. What is the death rate?
exp: Death rate is calculated as the total number of deaths per 1000 population. Since 50 persons died in 5000 population, the death rate would be 10 per 1000

question: Which of the following country has maximum life expectancy at bih:-
exp: Life expectancy at bih in selected countries 2017 Country Males Females India 67 70 Japan 81 87 USA 76 81 Singapore 81 85 - Hence, among given options, Japan has maximum life expectancy at bih.

question: A person is said to be killed by Road traffic accident (A) if he dies within how many days of accident?
exp: Road fatality After 2005, person who died within 30 days of a road crash is said to be killed by road traffic accident. Before 2005, fatalities were counted within six days of road traffic accident.

question: "Demographic bonus" connotes the period when the dependency ratio in a population declines because of :-
exp: "Demographic bonus" connotes the period when the dependency ratio in a population declines because of decline in feility, until it stas to rise again because of increasing longevity. "Demographic burden" is used to connote the increase in the total dependency ratio during any period of time, mostly caused by increased old age dependency ratio Dependency ratio = (Propoion of ppl in < 15yrs of age + >65yrs of age) / Propoion of ppl in 15-64 yrs of age

question: Crude bih rate of a Country XYZ has staed decreasing, but crude death rate is already decreasing. Country lies in which stage of Demographic cycle?
exp: Demographic cycle based on CBR & CDR Demographic cycle CBR CDR 1st stage High stationary High High 2nd stage Early expanding High Sta decreasing 3rd stage Late expanding Sta decreasing Already decreasing 4th stage Low stationary Low Low 5th stage Declining CDR > CBR - India, currently is in stage-3.

question: Potential Suppo Ratio (PSR) is defined as:
exp: PSR =Potential Suppo Ratio (PSR) is defined as Number of persons aged 15-65 per one older person aged >/= 65 years Gives burden on working population PSR a 1/ Old age dependency ratio
opa: Number of persons aged 15-65 per children below 15 years
opb: Number of persons aged 15-65 per one older person aged >/= 65 years
opc: Number of person aged 15-65 per one older person aged > 65 and younger person < 15 years
opd: Number of persons aged 15-65 persons older person aged > 60 and younger person < 15 years

question: The useful feility indicator where bih registration statistics do not exist or are inadequate is:
exp: Child-Woman ratio It is no. of Children 0-4yrs of age per 1000 women of child bearing age,usually defined as 15-44 or 49 yrs of age. This ratio is used where bih registration statistics do not exist or are inadequate

question: Average no. of girls that would be born to a woman if she experiences the current feility pattern throughout her reproductive span (15-44 or 49 years), assuming no moality known as:-
exp: Term Definition Net reproduction rate Total No. of girl children born to a female, taking into account their moality. Gross reproduction rate Total no. of girl children born to a woman if she experiences the current feility pattern throughout her reproductive span (15-44 or 49 years), assuming no moality Total marital feility rate Total no. of children that would be born to a married woman if she experiences the current feility pattern throughout her reproductive span Total feility rate Total no.of children born to each woman if she were to live to the end of her child-bearing years and give bih to children in alignment with the prevailing age-specificfeility rates.

question: Which of the following is not true about Crude Bih Rate?
exp: Crude bih rate - Measure of feility Measures the incidence of live bihs in the total population in a given period of time (one year). The numerator is a sub-set of the denominator;so it is a Rate. It is independent of the age structure of the population.
opa: It is a measure of feility
opc: It is independent of the age structure of the population
opd: Numerator does not include still bihs

question: The demographic goal of NRR= 1 can be achieved only if the CPR exceeds:
exp: Couple Protection Rate (CPR) It is defined as the percent of eligible couples effectively protected against childbih by one or other approved methods of family planning, viz. sterilization, IUD, condom or oral pills. It is an indicator of prevalence of contraceptive practice in the community. Demographers are of the view that the demographic goal of NRR= 1 can be achieved only if the CPR exceeds 60 percent. To achieve NNR=1, ideal contraception is Sterilization.

question: A country with mid-year population of 10 lac has Crude death rate of 20. Calculate the total no. of deaths per year?
exp: Crude death rate = Total No. of deaths during that year/Midyear population X 1000 20 = No. of deaths during the year/ 1000000 X 1000 No. of deaths during the year = 20 X 1000000 /1000 No. of deaths during the year = 20000

question: A city with 800 deaths per year. In mouary body is stored for an average duration of 8 days with 80% occupancy in a year. What number of mouary beds are needed per day ?
exp: Total number of bed = No. of deaths X average duration of storage = 800 X 8 = 6400 beds per year Bed needed Per day = 6400/365 = 17.5 beds per day This is true for 100% occupancy For 80% occupancy = 17/80 X 100 = 22 beds per day

question: Numerator of Dependency ratio is:-
exp: Dependency Ratio (DR) : The Propoion of persons above 65 years of age and children below 15 years of age are considered to be dependent on economically productive age group.( 15 - 64 years) DR = Propoion of persons < 15 years age and > 65 years age / Propoion of persons 15 - 64 years age.

question: Demographic processes includes all except :-
exp: Demography is the scientific study of human population. It focuses its attention on three readily observable human phenomena: Changes in population size (growth or decline) Composition of the population and Distribution of population in space. It deals with 5 "demographic processes" like feility moality marriage migration & social mobility These five processes are continuously at work within a population determining size, composition and distribution.

question: The number of live bih per 1000 women in the Reproductive age group in a year refers to:-
exp: General Feility Rate : Number of live bih per 1000 women in the Reproductive age group in a year. Term Definition Net reproduction rate Total No. of girl children born to a female, taking into account their moality. Gross reproduction rate Total no. of girl children born to a woman if she experiences the current feility pattern throughout her reproductive span (15-44 or 49 years), assuming no moality Total marital feility rate Total no. of children that would be born to a married woman if she experiences the current feility pattern throughout her reproductive span Total feility rate Total no.of children born to each woman if she were to live to the end of her child-bearing years and give bih to children in alignment with the prevailing age-specific feility rates

question: Vital statistics in a population include:-
exp: Population statistics Vital statistics Population size Sex ratio Density of population Dependency ratio Bih rate, death rate Natural growth rate Life expectancy at bih Moality rates Feility rates

question: If TFR in a population is 4, then GRR would be (approx.)
exp: - GRR or NRR= 1/2 TFR (approx.) - In given question, TFR is 4; hence GRR is half of 4 = 2
